content: this legal case involves a coownership property consisting of two houses and a courtyard the court has decided to dissolve the coownership and sell the property through a public auction the achieved value will be divided between the parties with petitioner ap receiving half of the value for a specific part of the building and respondent rh receiving a portion of a commercial building the decision is based on the property act and expert opinions the property cannot be physically divided so selling it is the best solution the estimated market value of the property is 11054956 euros the petitioners argue that the expert report is incomplete and does not assess the value of the ground floor apartment the court visited the apartment and described its layout the expert concluded that the market value of the apartment was 52550 eur the petitioners proposed to divide the property and pay the respondent a certain amount but the court expert provided another valuation and a resolution was reached for one party to pay a sum of 19445000 kn the petitioners proposed a settlement agreement for joint ownership and to pay the respondent a total amount of 61288008 kn the respondent objected to the valuation report and suggested preparing a new report the acceptable value of the property was determined to be 63508749 kn due to contradictions and changes in property conditions a new expert examination is proposed the court suggests a public auction of the properties and accepts the expert opinion the proceeds from the auction will be distributed according to the parties ownership shares
